Argentina: Juan Manuel de Rosas became governor of Buenos Aires Province
Australia:
Charles Sturt charted the Darling River.
Captain Charles Fremantle took possession of the western side of Australia for the British crown.
The settlement of Perth was founded.
Canada: Shanawdithit, the last known living member of the Beothuk people native to Newfoundland, dies; she was about 29 years old.
Chile: Chilean Civil War of 1829. After several battles, Joaquín Prieto defeats Ramón Freire in the Battle of Lircay.
Ireland: Catholic Emancipation: The Catholic Relief Act 1829 is passed, allowing Catholics to sit in the UK Parliament.
Poland: Coronation of Nicholas I of Russia.
Russia: Russo-Turkish War (1828–1829): The Treaty of Adrianople was signed, ceding the eastern shore of the Black Sea and the mouth of the Danube to the Russians.
